author: gustapug
title: Educate, Innovate, Develop
description: How can we expand the boundaries of Cardano towards basic, academic, informal, and community education?

f6_assessments.q0: According to the team that prepared this proposal for the next fund's challenge, there are other areas of education that must be explored beyond the content that is available to investors and developers. I must admit that the team managed to make a very good argument that one could not disagree with. Does it align with Cardano's mission? Yes, if we look at it with a long-term perspective. I must say, however, that when comparing this with the strategic goals of the next fund, it is hard to find a direct alignment between the two. My score is 4.
f6_assessments.q1: According to a review of the proposals submitted in the previous fund, there is no evidence that proposals will be submitted that address this issue. However, considering the capabilities needed to address it I would agree. However, I have two concerns. Firstly the amount of budget requested, for a type of challenge like this, where it is necessary to test the community's ability to address this challenge I would recommend to the team to reduce the budget requested, this way we give ourselves the opportunity to experiment, but at the same time control the level of risk of consuming treasury funds inefficiently. And second is the presence of a challenge with very similar characteristics, in case both are selected we could expose ourselves to the risk of dispersion of the community's capacity to address both challenges. My score is 4.
f6_assessments.q2: In this aspect I found a definition of the success criteria quite accurate, concrete and easy to interpret. Nevertheless, when analyzing the metrics, I find that most of them focus on measuring the performance of the challenge itself, instead of presenting metrics that serve as a guide or model for potential proposers. On this point, I recommend that you separate the metrics focused on the challenge (because I believe there is a great deal of value there too) and on the other hand the metrics focused on the proposals so as to better measure the progress made in approaching the challenge. My score is 4.

f6_assessments.q0: Education is an important aspect of any society, with blockchain going global, Cardano has to view all the audience as one society and provide one platform share knowledge. There are numerous boundaries and obstacles in knowledge sharing by conventional media. The available media are either not structured or not affordable or not commercially viable. Another aspect of this challenge would be the ill-placed(not exactly, but can be avoided) education material in challenge settings like, Grow (Region)-Grow Cardano, Film and Media. The content may be educative to all audiences instead it is placed alongside the media which is aimed at helping investors and on-boarding videos, and the film videos which are mainly comprised of documentaries. How ever the proposal lacks a differentiating factor when compared to the already well established platforms
f6_assessments.q1: Although this challenge addresses the current challenge, it may give rise to a new challenge of educative videos in other challenges and vice verse. There may be increased effort required to scrutinize such entries. Also this may lead to multiple proposal being put up with minute modifications to fit in multiple challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are well defined, including the parameter of new proposers. But the competence of the proposer and feedback of the user/student should be considered in-terms of experience, when compared to other platforms should be considered.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge focuses on the educational sector, proposes to expand Cardano influence through academic, informal and community education. 

Incentivizing education practitioners motivated by the creation of better practices in their countries, promoting positive impact in schools and universities. 
This challenge needs more refinement as it is not fully clear, if this challenge promotes education about Cardano and the community, or does it promote work of education in general.
f6_assessments.q1:
The challenge team is stating that this challenge will establish dialogues between Cardano and the educational sector. But there is no further explanation as to how. 
The mention of non-technical proposers is also missing explanation as to what does define a person a 'non-technical' one, I assume that here it is meant to inform all educators from all fields of education, to use this challenge for their proposals.
The challenge team comprises of four persons, there are no further details about the members.
f6_assessments.q2:
Key measures are defined to document the workings inside this challenge.
The last measure, "fair distribution of funded proposals across the continents", I cannot accept this kind of measure to be 100% on the positive side, continents are geographic land mass constraints, if taken as the measure. I suggest to either change this or make it more clearly defined, what is the exact measure? Who does decide here on fair distribution?

f6_assessments.q0:
I like the idea of mixing the education world (since school until universities) with Cardano. It wouklld bring a lot of experience from outisde in matters such as teaching skills, research, dealing with diversity, oratory and so on, present in education that would add value to cardano. At the same time, educational institution could benefit with projects that would make the interest in programming, blockchain and solution-driven approaches flourish in their students. It's a win-win challenge. 

The only issue I see is not to make this challenge only about proposing blockchain courses. There are already plenty of it available (and some funded by catalyst), in a lot of languanges and in a variety of formats. Of courses new approaches and languages can always be explored, but here there is an opportunity to go beyond that and really be present and engage with educational professionals, institutions and students, leveraging their community capilarity, infrastrucuture and skills.

Moreover, I see this challenge very in line with F9 strategic goals of "Prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem" and "Accelerate the growth and evolution of developer & app ecosystem". Having these institutions and people engaged are also critical to achieve Cardano's mission, as nothing is created without proper education.
f6_assessments.q1:
Community is totally capable of addressing this challenge. there are already plenty of professors and university students proposing here, in other challenges, both to develop solutions and to take cardano to educational world. Usually they are indeed focused in university but it's a good opportunity also to take Cardano to schools.

As there's no challenge team established, I"ll score it as 4.
I'd also include here potential direction suggestions.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are really good kpis proposed that will certainly help to verify challenge progress. I like the variety of proposals in in different educational levels (basic education, university), sectors and geographic distribution is considered.

It would be nice also to se a kpi for somehow measure social impact in low income regions/students. Educational is a powerful social transformation tool and this challenge can levarage this. Having proposal focused on the poorest, who attend schools or universities (or even those who wish to) would benefit society a lot!

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge proposal aims at growing the number of people educated to blockchain tech in general, and cardano’s tech by seeking education-focused proposal. This challenge does address Fund 9 strategic goals #1 and #3 by growing the number of people able and willing to contribute to the ecosystem. 
The 4-star score is motivated by the fact that this challenge proposal is very similar to Cardano4Education proposal, and because this brief is less impactful. I consider that it would less engage proposers, and therefore have a lower impact thant Cardano4Education Challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The challenge brief is lacking details about what a proposal should or should not look like (apart from general success criteria). 
Nevertheless, considering Cardano’s is based on Haskell that is considered by many as more difficult than other languages, I’m convinced that many developers will share the importance of Education for Cardano’s growth and that good quality proposals will be made for this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: General challenge metrics are set, including the number of proposals submitted in the challenge, the number of new proposers. Some metrics are not easily measurable, like the variety of proposals. Additional guidance in the challenge brief may be useful to ensure that proposers describe meaningful criteria and metrics to follow the development of their project.

f6_assessments.q0: It is true that education is really important so that having more projects related to education serves sustainable development goals of Cardano mission. However, this challenge does not show much or stress on the effectiveness of attracting more members joining Catalyst community. (The challenge should explain how can people be attracted to Cardano system through the Education projects belong to this challenge).
f6_assessments.q1: The Catalyst community already includes many scholars and academia, who have interest in education and broaden values of Cardano into non-technical adoption. Moreover, there are many projects related to education on other challenges of the past Funds. So definitely that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics are set correctly: they includes measurable KPIs and clear goals that will be good instruction for proposers to join the challenge. However, the success criteria is not really clear: how can we know the educators and students getting benefitted from projects beyond educational content for investors and developers? So some key metrics related to this should be added.

importance: Quality education is key for development in any sector. We need to onboard education projects to Cardano to make it better for the world
success: Having lots of educators and students getting benefitted from projects, much beyond educational content for investors and developers.
